title: Aztec, Inca & Maya
creator: Baquedano, Elizabeth
description: 63 pages : 29 cm Chronicles the history, beliefs, and everyday lives of the ancient Aztec, Inca, and Maya peoples Includes index "A Dorling Kindersley Book"--Title page verso

title: Aztec, Inca and Maya
creator: Snedden, Robert
description: 46 pages : 30 cm We rely on technology so much in the modern world to make our lives easier and better and enbale us to work faster. Many of our technologies are rooted in the past, however, and this book looks at technological advances of the Aztec, Inca and Maya civilizations set against the way the people lived then "An Appleseed Editions book." Includes bibliographical references and index

title: The illustrated guide to Latin American mythology : tales from the Aztec, Maya, Inca, and Amazon peoples
description: 144 pages : 31 cm Draws on the myths and legends of the great civilizations of the Aztec, Mayan and Inca empires, as well as those of the Amazon tribes. Sheds light on contemporary life and illuminates the spiritual beliefs and main preoccupations of these people

title: Ancient Aztec and Maya
description: 64 p. : 27 cm Examines the leading Indian civilizations of Latin America and native North Americans, discussing their history, culture, food and shelter, government and trade, and geographical information Includes bibliographical references (p. 63) and index Timeline -- Ancient America -- First Americans -- North America after the Ice Age -- The Arctic -- The burial mound builders -- Temple mound builders -- Mound sites -- The northern Iroquoians -- The Great Plains -- The far West -- Southwest sites -- Chaco Canyon -- Northwest coast -- Mesoamerica -- The Olmec civilization -- Mesoamerican sites -- Teotihuacán -- Maya civilization -- Palenque -- The Toltecs -- Chichén Itzá -- The Aztec empire -- The Aztec capital -- The central Andes -- Central Andean sites -- The Inca -- Inca sites

title: Aztec and Maya myths
creator: Taube, Karl A
description: 80 pages : 24 cm Includes bibliographical references (pages 78-79) and index Introduction -- Major sources and the history of research -- Aztec mythology -- Maya mythology -- Mesoamerican mythology

title: Ancient Maya and Aztec civilizations
creator: Wood, Marion, 1945-

title: Religion and empire : the dynamics of Aztec and Inca expansionism
creator: Conrad, Geoffrey W
description: xii, 266 pages : 24 cm Includes bibliographical references (pages 231-261) and index The Aztec imperial expansion -- The Inca imperial expansion -- Precolumbian imperialism : theories and evidence -- Ideology and cultural evolution
